descripGrp.descrip: In Music, a highly personalized form of auto-playlist (rules-based playlist) that is created by Microsoft for the customer, drawing music from the customer's music collection, and, if the customer has an active music pass, may also include songs from our music catalog.
Cellular data that customers can buy from the Windows Store to connect to their Windows device.
A Wi-Fi data or cellular data network that customers can connect to by buying minutes from the Windows Store.
An area in the Music app where recently played songs/albums and service-generated mixes are aggregated.
The Microsoft Edge developer tool to profile a web page frame rate. This tool helps you see what is happening behind the scenes when your pages are slowing down.
A list of teams or contestants arranged according to their past records.
The highest price that a stock has traded at during the previous 52 weeks.
The lowest price that a stock has traded at during the previous 52 weeks.

Very specific set of stocks of large, well-established and financially sound companies that have operated for many years, typically with a market capitalization in the billions and considered to be very sound investments.
A calculator tool that converts the value or quantity of one currency into the relative values or quantities of other currencies.

A financial ratio that shows how much a company pays out in dividends each year relative to its share price. In the absence of any capital gains, the dividend yield is the return on investment for a stock.
The portion of a company's profit allocated to each outstanding share of common stock. Earnings per share serves as an indicator of a company's profitability.
Exchange-traded funds that have shown high trading activity.
A marketplace in which securities, commodities, derivatives, and other financial instruments are traded.

In financial theory, the return that stockholders require for a company. A firm's cost of equity represents the compensation that the market demands in exchange for owning the asset and bearing the risk of ownership.

An intangible asset that arises as a result of the acquisition of one company by another for a premium value, including brand name, solid customer base, good customer relations, good employee relations and any patents or proprietary technology.
A valuation ratio used by investors which compares a stock's per-share price (market value) to its book value (shareholders' equity).
A feature tool that enables a user to calculate savings to hit retirement planning goals.
A tool for calculating earnings on saving deposits.

Amount of net income returned as a percentage of shareholders equity. ROI measures a corporation's profitability by revealing how much profit a company generates with the money shareholders have invested.
A feature that displays the prices of securities; name is derived from a telegraphic receiving instrument that automatically printed stock quotations on ticker tape.

The income return on an investment. This refers to the interest or dividends received from a security and is usually expressed annually as a percentage based on the investment's cost, its current market value or its face value.
A tool that enables a user to compute the future value of money.
A feature that allows a user to explore human anatomy with 3D imaging.
A feature that allows a user to track physical activity.
A feature that counts/tracks daily calorie intake.
A feature that allows the user to track eating patterns to track cardio exercise activities.
A feature that allows the users to compute the distance they have run or walked and the calories they have burned.
A feature that allows a user to search conditions, medicines and procedures.
A feature that allows the users to track running fitness.
A menu item that allows counts the actions of putting one leg in front of the other in walking or running.
A feature that allows a user to check medical symptoms to diagnose illness.
Selected top celebrity chefs or star cooks currently featured on MSN site.
Selected or favorite cocktails currently featured on MSN site.
Selected or favorite ingredients currently featured on MSN site.
Selected or favorite recipes currently featured on MSN site.
Selected Food & Drink providers currently featured on MSN site.
A feature that allows a user to search for flights on airlines.
A feature that allows a user to check the status of a given airline flight.
A feature that allows a user to search for hotels at a given location.
Final end-item product assembly before customer fulfillment.
The homepage for MSN.
An MSN page that allows the user to choose a required worldwide location.
The utility that IoT developers can use to find available Windows 10 IoT Core devices to which they can deploy apps.

The Microsoft business desktop publishing program that enables users to easily create professional-looking marketing materials by providing built-in professional design expertise and enhanced automation tools.

The Microsoft project management software used to plan, manage, and communicate a project schedule and other information among workgroup members, project managers, and other stakeholders, and provide additional collaborative enterprise project management capabilities when used with Microsoft Office Project Server.
A device (e.g. phone, tablet, or PC) that runs Windows.
A PC that runs Windows.
A phone that runs Windows 10 Mobile.
A tablet device that runs Windows.
The app developed by Microsoft to create, print, and scan in 3D.
The Microsoft relational database management system that combines the Jet engine and a graphical user interface and which allows developers to build software applications.
The Microsoft offer for Office that supports common business tasks, and that includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Outlook, Publisher, Access, and Skype for Business.
The Microsoft business diagramming and drawing software, designed for business users working on diagrams individually.
The edition of Microsoft Office that includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneNote, and Publisher.
The Sway feature that shows the set of potential colors and which elements they will be applied to.
A methodology to selectively expose parts of code or functionality to different sets of end users. Often used to validate functionality or behavior before the product official release.
The option for getting Insider preview builds after first Insider users.
The option for getting Insider preview builds first before most Insider users.
A feature that allows you to bookmark webpages and articles to read later.
The capability that lets you place or receive calls.
The UI option on the Start menu to shut down, restart the computer, or put the computer to sleep.
A local area network (LAN) to which mobile users (clients) can connect and communicate by means of high-frequency radio waves rather than wires. WLANs are specified in the IEEE 802.11 standard
The plug-in that delivers additional functionality to the Photos app on Windows devices.
A feature in OneNote on Microsoft Surface Hub where you can draw with the Surface Hub pens or with touch.
An app that tests and repairs problems in Office, Office 365, Outlook, OneDrive, and other Office apps.
An app that tests and repairs problems in Office, Office 365, Outlook, OneDrive, and other Office apps.
An app that tests and repairs problems in Office, Office 365, Outlook, OneDrive, and other Office apps.
The advertising network that enables developers to access various advertising technologies and deliver digital advertising to various audiences.
The app, developed by Microsoft, for purchasing cellular data that is packaged with cellular enabled Microsoft Surface devices that include a Microsoft SIM.
The cellular network service provided by Transatel for use with a Microsoft SIM card.

The marketing campaign that encourages people in the Windows Insider Program to earn badges for helping their friends and family upgrade to Windows 10. This is also the name of the app that helps Windows Insiders track how many badges they've earned in this campaign.
The service that provides suggestions to users for improving the design of their documents that can be applied with a single tap.

The service for downloading Windows updates and Windows Store apps from sources in addition to Microsoft and sending them to other PCs in a local network or on the Internet reducing the amount of Internet bandwidth needed.

The service for downloading Windows updates and Windows Store apps from sources in addition to Microsoft and sending them to other PCs in a local network or on the Internet reducing the amount of Internet bandwidth needed.
A reminder created by handwriting the text.
To make a record of transactions or activities that take place on a computer system.
A visual indication to inform the user of recent events.
A mark or piece of information that you can add to a map, save, and share with others.
A mark or piece of information that you can add to a map, save, and share with others.
A partitioning of the life of a product into phases that guide the project from identifying customer needs through product retirement.

An iterative and incremental agile software development methodology for managing product development defining "a flexible, holistic product development strategy where a development team works as a unit to reach a common goal", challenges assumptions of the "traditional, sequential approach" to product development, and enabling teams to self-organize by encouraging physical co-location or close online collaboration of all team members, as well as daily face-to-face communication among all team members and disciplines in the project.

An iterative and incremental agile software development methodology for managing product development defining "a flexible, holistic product development strategy where a development team works as a unit to reach a common goal", challenges assumptions of the "traditional, sequential approach" to product development, and enabling teams to self-organize by encouraging physical co-location or close online collaboration of all team members, as well as daily face-to-face communication among all team members and disciplines in the project.
The Facebook mobile app that is built and is distributed by Microsoft.

The wireless personal area network technology, launched in 2010 and marketed as Bluetooth Smart, used for transmitting data over distances as much as 100 meters. Cost and power consumption are low while maintaining a communication range similar to Bluetooth BR/EDR, the other widely-used version of Bluetooth
A Bluetooth Low Energy device that sends static information, such as location or ID, to devices within its area.
A feature for maps of the interior of some public places, such as the businesses inside a mall, or the gates, businesses, and other services inside an airport.
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of apps or services made available in an enterprise to help with particular business and process needs.
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of apps or services made available in an enterprise to help with particular business and process needs.

The app for PC and Surface Hub that helps you connect a phone or PC to the Surface Hub display, or to another PC. On Surface Hub, it also allows you to switch between devices that are connected to the Surface Hub.​
A mode in which the UI on the screen slides downward so that the user can reach items that normally would be near the top of the screen with one hand.
The app for purchasing cellular data that is packaged with cellular enabled Dell devices that include a Microsoft SIM card.
The collection of TV shows that are in the top N% of ratings.
The collection of items emphasized to the customer through placement on the site.
To make your search results more relevant by excluding unwanted and extraneous items.
A feature that allows customers to temporarily connect to available free Wi-Fi hotspots in order to find and buy Wi-Fi services from the Windows Store.
A device agent that responds to voice, text, and inked natural language queries and can help you do all kinds of things, including tasks, suggestions, and passing the time.
To install an operating system image on a device, reformatting all partitions as part of the process.
The web-based interface that is included as part of specialized Windows devices and used by developers to manage device services remotely.
The web-based interface that is included as part of specialized Windows devices and used by developers to manage device services remotely.
The standalone 3D scanning app available in the Windows Store.​​
The feature of the 3D Scanner app that allows users to take 3D selfies.​
A 3D printing format that allows design applications to send 3D models to other applications, platforms, services, and printers.​
The rectangular boundaries of the object to be scanned.​​
A feature that simulates a body scanning booth by using a turntable in combination with the Kinect.​​​
A circular revolving platform where you can place an object for 3D scanning.​​
The multi-app package for Windows 10 that includes the Messaging app for SMS, instant messaging, and Skype chat, and the Skype video app for VoIP video and audio calling.
A balance that indicates the amount of Skype credit that remains on an account.
An image representing the user, visible under their profile
The feature which allows users to send a Moji via the chat.
Praise received from another user for an achievement.
The combination of enterprise-related hardware and software security features that, when configured together, will lock a device down so that it can only run trusted applications.​​​
The section of Windows Store for Business where admins can sign policies and catalogs of approved software, including LOB apps, using enterprise-specific signing certificates.​
The category of fonts that make it easier for people with dyslexia to read.​
A generic reference to an organization's Windows Store for Business to offer specific content to their users, and for users to download approved content.
A map downloaded to your PC, phone or tablet that can be used to get directions and search for places even when you are not connected to the Internet.
A person or business that makes line-of-business apps available to customers through an online market.
A person or business that makes line-of-business apps available to customers through an online market.
An application that is licensed by a company in bulk for use by end users.
A feature that allows you to tap a phone against another device to pay for a purchase using a credit or debit card enrolled in Microsoft Wallet as a method of payment.
The service designed to provide single sign-on for browser, apps, and services.
The app ​that lets you edit a song, so you can save part of it as a ringtone.​
The security feature that uses virtualization-based security to help protect your domain credentials from being collected by malware.
The tool that allows you to recover a phone that is not responding, is frozen, or is experiencing other software-related issues.
A user role within Windows Store for Business that allows the user to manage the Windows Store for Business account settings and inventory.
A user role within Microsoft Store for Business that allows the user to directly provide apps to individuals and groups within the organization.
A short video clip that can be downloaded from Skype in a package of similar video clips, and can be inserted into a chat conversation.​

The Universal Windows app that allows a person to add credit cards that can be used to pay for things with their phones using NFC. The app can also be used to save loyalty cards, coupons, boarding passes, and event tickets.

The Universal Windows app that allows a person to add credit cards that can be used to pay for things with their phones using NFC. The app can also be used to save loyalty cards, coupons, boarding passes, and event tickets.
To mark a location on a map by interacting directly with the map, instead of searching for an address or place name.
A location marker that users can manually add to a map, so they can see it on the map and get additional location info and directions.
The place inside Microsoft Wallet where you store your credit cards, loyalty cards, coupons, boarding passes, and event tickets.
The Azure tool that allows information workers to join their personal devices with their company's workplace computers to access company resources and services.
An amount of money added to an account.
The Office servicing option in which new feature upgrades are available for installation right after they were first published by Microsoft.

The servicing option in which new feature upgrades are available for installation after first published by Microsoft, enabling long-term deployment of selected releases in low-change configurations. The minimum length of servicing lifetime is approximately 10 years.

The servicing option in which new feature upgrades are available for installation after first published by Microsoft, enabling long-term deployment of selected releases in low-change configurations. The minimum length of servicing lifetime is approximately 10 years.

The feature set that integrates data protection at the platform level so as to protect corporate data against inadvertent disclosure to unauthorized users and public services through email, social media and public cloud. It includes encryption of enterprise data when it enters the device or is created on the device, such that data stays protected against disclosure to applications and endpoints outside enterprise control.

It includes encryption of enterprise data when it enters the device or is created on the device, such that data stays protected against disclosure to applications and endpoints outside enterprise control.

It includes encryption of enterprise data when it enters the device or is created on the device, such that data stays protected against disclosure to applications and endpoints outside enterprise control.
The app that consumers can use to send feedback to the Windows team, to check for responses to that feedback, and to get news about the latest updates.
The app that consumers can use to send feedback to the Windows team, to check for responses to that feedback, and to get news about the latest updates.
A group of settings that admins can use to manage files and operating system settings on enterprise-owned devices.

The modern implementation of Windows PowerShell built on .NET Core. It includes a command-line shell, scripting language, and automation engine, providing IT administrators comprehensive control and automation of system administration tasks across multiple platforms.

The phone app that helps customers transfer content from their Android phone to their Windows 10 Mobile phone. There are 2 instances of the app, one that you install on Android, and one that you install on Windows (phone only).​​
A statistical measure of the reliability of an estimate, which calculates the margin of error.
An application that provides step counts, workouts, sleep quality data and a web dashboard to give insights into physical activity benefits to the user’s overall health.
The display technology that provides high-resolution display, touch and ink capabilities, wide-viewing angle, and more.
The Project work management app that helps a team create new plans, organize and assign work, share files, discuss team activity, and get updates on progress.
The category of apps or games that are selected based on downloads, usage, and revenue over a 7-day period and ranks them according to those metrics.
The category for items that are in the top 1000 items based on sales.
The view of a particular contact within the People app that shows all your past communication, upcoming meetings, status updates, and files you share with that person. ​

Not containing any ads being played beforehand.

Pertaining to contacts who are currently Offline.

An update where Microsoft delivers new features and other significant changes.

The feature that allows users to send and receive SMS and MMS messages on a Windows device with no cellular data connection, such as a PC, using a Windows phone as the transport.
The feature of the Alarms & Clock app where you can add and view multiple clocks from cities around the world.
The Learning Tools feature that highlights verbs and their subordinate clauses.
A clock in the World Clock app that displays the current local time in any city in the world. You can have multiple clocks to display the local times from cities around the world.
The Excel function that returns text that occurs after a given substring in a given string.
The Excel function that returns text that occurs before a given substring in a given string.

The tool that aids in reading comprehension by displaying a reading-focused view with optimized font spacing, and by reading text aloud while highlighting it, breaking words down into syllables, and translating text.
A privacy setting that allows the operating system, apps, and services to detect a user's approximate location (within several miles/km), without sharing their exact location.
A location that you can set for your device that can be used by Windows, apps, and services when an exact location isn't available, such as on a desktop PC without GPS.​ ​

A lock screen feature for mobile devices that lets users see their clock and lock screen info at a glance after your screen has turned off.​​
The app that teachers can use to provision student PCs for classroom use.​

The education app used for secure, online assessments, such as exams. It doesn't allow test takers to access resources stored on their device or the internet; it prevents OS-level distractions; and it doesn't allow test-takers to share test content with other students.​

The Azure service that delivers high availability and network performance to applications. It distributes incoming traffic among healthy service instances in cloud services or virtual machines defined in a load-balancer set.

A person who uses software internally before the software is released for production or public visibility. The person may be part of a coordinated effort where multiple users attempt to find errors in coding or logic that cause the software to malfunction.
To use software internally before the software is released for production or public visibility, aiming at finding errors in coding or logic that cause the software to malfunction.

Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of the process of testing software internally before releasing it for production or public visibility. May be part of a coordinated effort where multiple users attempt to find errors in coding or logic that cause the software to malfunction.
The app that integrates caller ID, block and filter, and quiet hours functionality to both Calling and Messaging apps on Windows mobile phones. This version is for markets other than China.
After a build update, to load an app with domain data (such as data from a database, from the network, or from a file system), during the download process. Before this step, the app cannot be used.

The Office 365 Education feature that allows the user to view their progress or the progress of their students and create surveys, quizzes, questionnaires, and registration forms whose result can be exported to Excel and embedded in other Microsoft applications.

The Windows Hello feature gives business customers the fastest and most secure way to sign-in to Windows devices, apps and services. It uses your face, fingerprint or companion device to recognize you instantly, no password needed.

A software development methodology in which releases are planned for regular intervals (i.e. monthly, quarterly, etc.) and features are planned according to that schedule. An award for successful completion of a challenge.
A collection of games, organized in one or more events, for competitive play.
Brand name for the elite wireless controller for Xbox One. Using 'controller' is OK when referring generically to the device.
Brand name for the Kinect adapter for the Xbox One S and PC.
Brand name for the stereo headset for Xbox One. Using 'headset' is OK when referring generically to the device.
Brand name for the stereo headset adapter for Xbox One.
A community-created place for like-minded people to play, share, and communicate on Xbox Live.
An online system to help like-minded people find each other, get into parties, and accomplish common goals in their favorite games on Xbox Live.
To stream content so that other people can watch and comment on it.
The button that allows users to change text size for an entire document.
A feature that allows users to change letter, word, line, and column spacing to reduce visual crowding.
A feature that reads text in an application to the user, highlighting the words as they are read.​
A feature that separates the syllables of each word with a dot, making content more easily readable for some people.
The service platform that centralizes the monitoring of all Azure resources.

Literally, "without stroke"; describes any typeface in which the characters have no serifs (the short lines or ornaments at the upper and lower ends of the strokes.) A sans serif typeface usually possesses a more straightforward, geometric appearance than a typeface with serifs and typically lacks the contrast between thick and thin strokes found in serif faces.
A feature that allows any markups done on the Surface Hub screen to appear in the file on the device you are using to project, provided that the app supports inking to Surface Hub.
A feature that lets you control your connected laptop, tablet, or phone from the Surface Hub touchscreen.

An external PC connected to the Surface Hub, with access to key peripherals on the Surface Hub, including the screen, pen, and touch features. In replacement PC mode, the Surface Hub internal computer is disabled.
A mechanism to set up clients to the cloud service.
A mechanism to remove clients from the cloud service.
The service that uses telemetry data to provide powerful upgrade readiness insights and recommendations about computers, applications, and drivers in an organization.
The service that uses telemetry data to provide powerful upgrade readiness insights and recommendations about computers, applications, and drivers in an organization.

The drawing app you can use to create simple or elaborate drawings. These drawings can be either black-and-white or color. You can also use Paint to work with pictures, such as .jpg, .gif, or .bmp files.

The drawing app you can use to create simple or elaborate drawings. These drawings can be either black-and-white or color. You can also use Paint to work with pictures, such as .jpg, .gif, or .bmp files.
A bar, appearing at the top, that displays a small preview image (thumbnail) of the content in each open tab.
A feature that allows you to see a small preview of the content in each open tab, shown in a persistent bar (not just on mouseover)​.
To clear or remove all tabs that are currently displayed, and save them as a set of tabs that you can restore later.
A record of the software updates installed in the product.
A rough, hand-drawn sketch.
A tool category for tools that take a 2D freehand drawing and automatically turn that drawing into a 3D object.
The font style that applies a classic look to the typography of the book that is being read.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read to maximize reading comprehension and speed.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read, resembling a newspaper or other news source.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read to minimize clutter and create a clean look.
The font style that applies a particular font to the book that is being read to make it look more fun and friendly.
The Microsoft touchscreen accessory for Surface devices that allows users to access menus and scroll and swipe through documents and images.
The Microsoft all-in-one touchscreen computer.
The Microsoft keyboard that is designed for Surface devices.
The feature within Microsoft Edge where people can access e-books and other e-publications that they purchase or download.
A feature that allows the user to convert an image of writing to editable digital ink.
The feature which allows you to stay connected and quickly interact and share with the people you care about most.
The major Windows 10 update to be released in Spring 2017, focused on creativity, 3D and mixed reality, 4K gaming, game broadcasting, among other features for both consumer and enterprise audiences.
A virtual environment in which a user's real surroundings are combined with virtual or holographic objects to create a customizable environment
A setting that adjusts the display to eliminate blue tones that may disrupt your ability to sleep at night.
An input mechanism used for targeting within holographic apps. It tells you where the user is looking in the world and lets you determine their intent.
A group of similar feedback displayed in search results, instead of showing all the duplicate feedback.
The area of the collection that contains the feedback you submitted.
The global shell voice command to select the item gaze cursor is on or, if the gaze cursor is not shown, to show the gaze cursor.
The global shell voice command used to invoke Cortana listening user experience.
The global shell voice command used to toggle on or off the Start menu.
The global shell voice command used to toggle on or off the Start menu.
The global shell voice command used to teleport the user to the position where gaze is at.
The Holobar button that closes an app or a 3D object.
The Holobar button that enters Adjust mode.
The Holobar button that exits Adjust mode.
The Holobar button that hides the 3D Holobar.
The Slate holobar button voice command (and tooltip text) that changes Select + Drag action to scroll Slate content. Button only present on HoloLens, not on Windows Holographic.
The Holobar button that switches to drag mode so that hold + path gesture over Slate does dragging.
The Slate holobar button voice command (and tooltip text) that changes Select + Drag action to zoom Slate content. Button only present on HoloLens, not on Windows Holographic.
The Holobar button that navigates back to the previous app page content.
The item in the Start menu that takes you to the All Apps list section of the Start menu.
The voice command (and tooltip text) for button on the Start Menu (Pins Panel, All Apps list) that takes the user to the previous page of items.
The voice command (and tooltip text) for button on the Start Menu (Pins Panel, All Apps list) that takes the user to the next page of items.
The item in the Start menu that takes you from the All Apps list section back to the Start menu.
The item in the Start menu that takes you to the Environments section of the Start Menu.
The item in the Start menu that pops out a live cube for the cliff house environment.
The item in the Start menu that goes into Video capture mode.
The item in the Start menu that goes to the screen to project to a device via Miracast.
The item in the Start menu that closes the screen opened for "Connect" and "Take me someplace."
The hologram manipulation voice command used to increase the targeted hologram size by a fixed percentage, up to a maximum size.
The hologram manipulation voice command that decreases the gaze-targeted hologram by a fixed percentage, down to a minimum size.
The hologram manipulation voice command used to turn the hologram's front to face the user.
The hologram manipulation voice command to put the hologram into placement mode, in which it follows the user's gaze, waiting for the user to place it.
The hologram manipulation command that follows the voice command "Move this..." or "Place", gazing at the intended location to place the hologram.
The hologram manipulation command that follows the voice command "Move this..." or "Place", gazing at the intended location to place the hologram.
The hologram manipulation command used to put down the hologram when in placement mode.
The button that you select to accept the contents of the dialog.
The button that you select to stop the task in progress and return to the previous state.
The mixed reality capture button that starts a video capture.
The mixed reality capture button that launches the UI for sharing a photo or video on Facebook or YouTube.
The mixed reality capture button that closes the Preview UI.
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains app install rule, SmartScreen settings, and exploit protection settings.​​​
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains information and actions related to performance and PC health.​​
The area of the Windows Defender app for ​family features, linking o the Family tab of the Microsoft account portal.​​
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains​ Windows Firewall and other network settings.​​
The area of the Windows Defender app that contains all functionalities related to antivirus and threat protection.​​

The exclusive community of young (Gen Z) users of 3D creation tools and applications in Windows, who are invited to creatively engage with and provide feedback on experimental 3D features and interactions.​
To hold the hand out with the index finger pointing up, and then tap the finger quickly down, then up again.
A gesture represented by holding the hand out with the index finger pointing up, then tapping the finger quickly down, then up again.
To hold out the hand, palm up, with fingertips touching and pointing up, and then open the hand.
A gesture represented by holding out the hand, palm up, with fingertips touching and pointing up, and then opening the hand.
To turn your head in order to move the cursor and target content for selection.
To air tap and keep the index finger in the down position.
A series of characters used to verify an account.
The instructions for how to get from one location to another by car or any other motor vehicle.
The instructions for how to get from one location to another by using local public transportation.
The instructions for how to get from one location to another on foot.
The result of remixing existing media to create a new version of that thing.
A JSON document that stores device state information (metadata, configurations, and conditions). The document includes tags, desired properties, and reported properties.
A virtual object made of light, which can be placed in physical or virtual space
The app in Windows Mixed Reality and on HoloLens that allows users to view and place holograms in their physical or virtual environment.
The app in Windows Mixed Reality and on HoloLens that allows users to view and place holograms in their physical or virtual environment.
The scale-out implementation of R Server integrated with Spark clusters created from HDInsight.
A network status tag that appears underneath an available Wi-Fi network and allows to select it in Windows network flyout.
The umbrella security brand for protecting Windows devices and users from malware and other threats.

The hardware-based container technology for apps, initially designed to host Microsoft Edge in order to enhance its security by using Microsoft's Hyper-V virtualization solution and leveraging device's hardware to run untrusted sites in a virtual machine.

The hardware-based container technology for apps, initially designed to host Microsoft Edge in order to enhance its security by using Microsoft's Hyper-V virtualization solution and leveraging device's hardware to run untrusted sites in a virtual machine.
The name for the integrated comercial console which includes antivirus, Device Guard, Firewall, and a number of other Windows devices features from a monitoring and response perspective.

The name of a Windows feature that enables IT to lock down devices so they can only use trusted devices and peripherals, and provides the capability to isolate parts of the operating system by using virtualization-based security (VBS).​
The mixed-reality shell experience, in which content can be placed and used in virtual (or, in the case of HoloLens, real) surroundings.
The app destination for solutions that extend the capabilities of the technology you already own.

A UI screen that appears in the Network flyout when a paid Wi-Fi hotspot is in range and paid Wi-Fi plans are available from Windows Store. A customer can then tap Connect with a data plan to open the Paid Wi-Fi & Cellular app, choose a paid Wi-Fi data plan that’s offered from Windows Store, and then buy a plan using the payment information that’s stored in their Microsoft account.

Any very simple computer program that outputs or displays the words "Hello World" in some form to the user. Such a program is often created as an example, to introduce the basic syntax of a programming language to students or others new to that language.
The offer for Project for Office 365 targeted at faculty members.
The offer for Project for Office 365 targeted at university students.
A web application on Xbox.com that allows Xbox One or PC gamers to design and purchase their own Xbox Wireless controller.

The Microsoft video streaming service that gives companies the ability to create a secure, encrypted video site, with custom channels, so that the entire company has access to videos any time from any location.

The Microsoft video streaming service that gives companies the ability to create a secure, encrypted video site, with custom channels, so that the entire company has access to videos any time from any location.

The Microsoft video streaming service that gives companies the ability to create a secure, encrypted video site, with custom channels, so that the entire company has access to videos any time from any location.

The Microsoft video streaming service that gives companies the ability to create a secure, encrypted video site, with custom channels, so that the entire company has access to videos any time from any location.
The customizable chat-based workspace in Office 365.
The customizable chat-based workspace in Office 365.
A data integration solution using the Data Factory service that can ingest data from various data stores, transform/process the data, and publish result data to the data stores.
Video content that provides a view in all directions, so the user can look around ​as if they are inside the video itself. It can be played on a PC, p​hone, Xbox, or AR/VR headset.
The branded spatial sound format that Microsoft is offering ​for headphones.

The edition of Windows 10 designed for small and medium businesses that includes the features of Windows 10 Pro, plus additional management policies that can be helpful to business customers. This edition is only available through subscription as part of a larger package of services, and is not available as a standalone download.
The icon that shows when someone @mentions somebody, likes something that person has posted, or replies to a thread somebody has started.
A subunit of a team in Microsoft Teams.
An action in which @ is added before a teammate's name to get his or her attention.
An organizational unit in Microsoft Teams where members work in channels and use available storage space and tools.
In Windows Mixed Reality and Windows Holographic, an app type or app state in which the app renders as a flat window, not an immersive experience.​
A Windows Insider servicing release cadence that allows users to receive Windows new features only after the Fast ring participants.
A Windows Insider servicing release cadence that allows users to receive Windows new features as soon as possible at the expense of possible bugs.

A Windows Insider servicing release cadence that allows to get early access to patches and fixes for their current builds, but not as early as the Slow ring, making this option safer and less prone to bugs than the other rings.
A unit of measure for the resource being consumed.

A numerical summary of an organization's security posture based on system configurations, user behavior and other security related measurements that represents the extent to which an organization has adopted security controls in their Microsoft environment which can help offset the risk of being breached.

Sound that is spatialized or is precisely located around a listener in 3D space. Developers can use spatial sound in an application to convincingly place sounds in a 3D space all around the user. Sounds will then seem as if they are coming from real physical objects even though the user may only be using regular stereo headphones.

Technology that enables a 3D graphics processor to display the image at the moment it is rendered for more fluid and better detailed gameplay, and for reducing or eliminating lag, stutter and frame tearing.

Technology that enables a 3D graphics processor to display the image at the moment it is rendered for more fluid and better detailed gameplay, and for reducing or eliminating lag, stutter and frame tearing.
The free mobile app for managing business activities such as jobs, tasks, locations, and scheduling, as well as sending and paying bills.
The free mobile app for managing business activities such as jobs, tasks, locations, and scheduling, as well as sending and paying bills.

The lightweight markup language with plain text formatting syntax designed to be converted to HTML and other formats and that is used to format readme files, write messages in online discussion forums, and create rich text using a plain text editor.

A movie created in the Photos app, featuring a set of related pictures and videos combined with a soundtrack, transitions and other effects. This term can also be used to refer to the set of photos and videos included in the story. ​A story may be created automatically by the app, or manually by the user.
A feature in Holograms app that allows the user to input text and have that text become a hologram that they can place in their space. User inputs text to make a holographic label.
The edition of Microsoft HoloLens hardware and software released for developers.
The edition of HoloLens sold for organizations. Includes the HoloLens Development Edition hardware, plus a warranty and enterprise features for added security and device management.
An action or mechanism to explicitly consent to participate in programs or offerings, typically for marketing purposes.
An action or mechanism to explicitly decline to participate in programs or offerings, typically for marketing purposes.
A stone cut and polished into a shape used in Windows Holographic/Windows Mixed Reality for training users to use their mixed reality device.

A program that enables qualified game developers of all sizes to unleash their creativity by self-publishing digital games on Xbox One and Windows 10 with Xbox Live, giving independent studios the tools and support needed to maximize their success.
To apply images, 2D shapes, textures, or custom stickers onto a 2D surface or 3D model in Paint 3D.
The Windows Holographic SKU that runs on the HoloLens Commercial Suite, when an Enterprise license is applied to the device.
An e-book file format with the extension .epub that can be downloaded and read on devices like smartphones, tablets, computers.

A graphic UI control consisting of a string of horizontal stars that allows users to report their level of satisfaction with a product, service, or experience and that visually indicates the aggregated rating of all users.
An artificial intelligence program that conducts conversations with other chatbots or users.
A person who develops programs, services, or other products for use with Microsoft systems and/or products.
A monthly subscription that provides unlimited access to a catalog of games, including popular backward compatible Xbox 360 and blockbuster Xbox One titles.
A monthly subscription that provides unlimited access to a catalog of games, including popular backward compatible Xbox 360 and blockbuster Xbox One titles.
A socket allowing computer memory (RAM) to be inserted into the computer.

An extension to the Windows Insider Program to include engagement for enterprises and SMEs through dedicated forums, blogs and events, regular surveys with IT professionals, as well as extensive documentation to support their organizations deploy Insider builds.

An extension to the Windows Insider Program to include engagement for enterprises and SMEs through dedicated forums, blogs and events, regular surveys with IT professionals, as well as extensive documentation to support their organizations deploy Insider builds.
A software program, usually an application, that shows a list of apps on a device that can be launched.
The Microsoft app for Android that allows users to browse Microsoft apps for Android.
The technology that allows viewing of a physical, real-world environment enriched by computer-generated sensory input such as sound, video, graphics or GPS data.
A website that customers can go to for help with Microsoft products.
The user-defined graphic that lights up to help users avoid obstacles in virtual reality.

In virtual reality on Windows, the name of one of the virtual environments (places) a user can choose as their virtual home. This environment looks like a modern house built onto a seaside cliff where users can move between the rooms by teleportation. In it, users can pin and use content, launch apps, etc.
In Windows Mixed Reality, the app that allows the user to see and interact with their PC desktop from within the mixed reality headset.
In mixed reality, an app view in which the app takes over the full display and becomes the only app you see.
The app in ​Windows Mixed Reality that teaches the user basic interactions and usage of the mixed reality interface. The app is accessed and used​ in the mixed ​reality headset.​

In Windows Mixed Reality​, the desktop app that allows the user to manage their mixed reality headset, get status on their mixed reality hardware, see a live stream of what's visible in the headset, and complete system setup.​
In Holographic, to situate and fix content, holograms, or mixed reality apps in your environment using a gesture, a controller button, or a voice command.
In Holographic, the act of targeting a UI element for selection. After pointing, the target can be selected using a controller button, a hand gesture, or a voice command.​​​
In mixed reality, the act of ​moving from place to place in the virtual world using a controller button or a voice command.
On mixed-reality controllers, the button with the Windows logo on it used to invoke the Start menu. Similar to the Windows logo key on a PC.
The mixed reality experience built into Windows that powers a compatible virtual reality headset or head-mounted display.

A container for a collection of configuration settings file with extension .ppkg. Provisioning packages are simple enough that with a short set of written instructions, a student or non-technical employee can use them to configure their device.
The academic disciplines of science, technology, engineering and mathematics, used when addressing education policy and curriculum choices in schools.

A collaborative work space, tool, app, or program for making, learning, exploring and sharing. It can refer to a literal space or place, or to digital environments where people are encouraged to create and share with a community.
A test with important consequences for the test taker or which is the basis of a major decision.
The portal where admins in educational institutions can acquire and distribute apps for their students, faculty, and staff to use.​​
The version of Visio that includes basic feature such as starter diagrams.

The version of Visio that includes all the features of Visio Standard as well as the ability to link diagrams in real time to sources, review and edit other users' diagrams, and to edit and view diagrams at the same time as other users.
A card that displays information about a person such as their picture and contact information.
A card that displays information about a person such as their picture and contact information.
A card that displays information about a person such as their picture and contact information.

An app that enables the users to view, organize, edit and share all of their photos and videos from multiple sources, and tell stories with them by making them into new videos. It replaces the default Photos app in Windows 10.
A pre-release version of a service or a feature that are made available to customers for evaluation purposes and at reduced or different service terms.
The solution that allows you to manage and protect corporate apps and data across devices with Microsoft Intune.

A feature within the Microsoft Rewards program, similar to the Punchcard experience within Xbox Live Rewards (which is transitioning into Microsoft Rewards). Users complete X, Y, and Z - things like daily quizzes, searches, and offers - to get a certain number of points.
To type @ before someone's name to get their attention in a message or conversation.
A record of all purchases made by a user from an online store or portal.
A technology that enables Wi-Fi devices to connect directly, without a router or other mechanism, making it simpler to do things like print, share, sync, and display.​
An app that enables members of a Language community to provide translation and language-related feedback about features. The app is currently available only for Windows Desktop.
A request to gather and send language feedback using quests in Feedback Hub and the Language Community app.​
The cloud service that helps protect your enterprise hybrid environments from multiple types of advanced targeted cyber attacks and insider threats.
To take an existing story in the Photos app and generate a new version of that story with edits to content, style, music, and other options.​

In Groove Music app, a graphical display that changes colors and shapes on the screen in response to the music that is playing. The user can choose from several different visualizers, which each look different.
To share recent social activity or media on Skype through the Highlights feature.
An item or activity shared on Skype through the Highlights feature.
A software offer for students and educators that allows shared computer activation.

The setting (toggle) on account.microsoft.com/family that, when switched on, requires children to get adult permission for the things they buy in the Windows and Xbox stores — except for what they get with gift cards or money in their Microsoft account.
The capability of Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection, which helps protect the data in the specified folder locations from modification by suspicious or malicious apps.
A feature in Groove Music that allows the sound in specified frequency bands to be amplified or reduced, in order to adjust the quality and character of the sound.​
A group of people who uses or shares a common language or dialect and contributes to language-related activities for Windows features.
A section in the Feedback Hub app where users can organize language-related activities for their Language community.

A set of tools that provides data-driven insights that can reduce the cost of deploying, servicing, and supporting Windows 10. It uses telemetry data to provide rich, actionable information to help assess the operational efficiency and health of Windows 10 devices in a user's environment.
The voice command to teleport the user to where the gaze cursor is at. Works on Windows Holographic only, not on HoloLens.
The voice command to open Feedback Hub app to the page for filing a new bug.
The Slate holobar button voice command (and tooltip text) that changes Xbox gamepad to function as how a gamepad does with games on Xbox. Button only present on Windows Holographic, not on HoloLens.

The Slate holobar button voice command (and tooltip text) that changes Xbox gamepad to function as an input control that uses the gaze cursor to select with the “A” button. Button only present on Windows Holographic, not on HoloLens.

The voice command (and button label + tooltip text) for button on the Start Menu that turns on/off the display of what user is seeing in mixed reality on the desktop Mixed Reality Portal app. Button only present on Windows Holographic, not on HoloLens (HoloLens has the “Connect” button instead where it projects what user sees to a Miracast device).
The voice command (and tooltip text) for button on the Start Menu that opens the UI for adjusting volume.
The voice command (and tooltip text) for button on the Start Menu that mutes volume.
The voice command (and tooltip text) for button on the Start Menu that unmutes volume.
The capability of Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection, which helps protect against malware that uses exploits to infect devices and spread.
A computer file format designed to store three-dimensional data that are described as a collection of polygons.
An open file format created as a simple way to import and export geometry from different 3D applications.
The button text, tooltip text, and voice command to start mixed reality photo capture mode from the Start Menu.

A hardware accessory that allows you to take action in mixed reality. It tracks a precise position in space, allowing for fine-grained interaction with digital objects. When using a Windows Mixed Reality immersive headset, the motion controller is the primary way to take action.

A hardware accessory that allows you to take action in mixed reality. It tracks a precise position in space, allowing for fine-grained interaction with digital objects. When using a Windows Mixed Reality immersive headset, the motion controller is the primary way to take action.
The Windows 10 update announced at Build 2017 and being released in the Sept-Nov 2017 timeframe.

The feature in Windows Defender Security Center that monitors your device and provides you with information and recommendations in a Health report to address common issues with your storage capacity, device drivers, battery life, or Windows Update.

The feature in Windows Defender Security Center that helps you refresh your device by reinstalling and updating Windows — for example, if your device has performance issues or you have too many unnecessary apps.
The pre-release version of Microsoft Remote Desktop app.
The pre-release version of Microsoft Remote Desktop app.
The period of time when users are required to schedule a restart.
A system service that enables spatial perception, spatial input, and holographic rendering.
The Microsoft interactive livestreaming platform for gaming communities.

The app that brings together friends, games, and accomplishments across Xbox One and Windows 10 devices. It allows users to stay connected to the Xbox Live community, see what their friends are playing, share game clips and screenshots, and view achievements across devices.

A head-mounted display (HMD) that displays mixed reality experiences. Used inclusively to denote both Microsoft HoloLens and OEM devices, whether they blend virtual content within the physical world (holographic headsets), or display virtual content with a degree (big or small) of environmental awareness (immersive headsets)​. Plus, these headsets can either be self-contained (like Microsoft HoloLens - the whole computing power is contained into the headset) or PC-connected (the computing power comes from the PC and the headset cannot work without that associated PC).

A head-mounted display (HMD) that displays mixed reality experiences. Used inclusively to denote both Microsoft HoloLens and OEM devices, whether they blend virtual content within the physical world (holographic headsets), or display virtual content with a degree (big or small) of environmental awareness (immersive headsets)​. Plus, these headsets can either be self-contained (like Microsoft HoloLens - the whole computing power is contained into the headset) or PC-connected (the computing power comes from the PC and the headset cannot work without that associated PC).

A head-mounted display (HMD) that displays virtual content only and with a degree (big or small) of environmental awareness. This is a subset of "mixed reality headset."​ This is to be looked at in contrast with "holographic headsets".
The process of moving from a lower version of a system to a higher version. A configuration shift where the user becomes able to change default settings which were locked before the shift.
To move from a lower version of a system to a higher one, or to shift system configuration in order to change default settings locked before the shift.

A virtual "home" environment in the Shell where the user can move around and explore. Users can also launch and place apps in the environment and the placed apps will persist between Shell sessions. In RS3, there is only one environment (Cliff House) but in the future there will be more.

A control on the motion controller. Inside the mixed reality Home users use the thumbstick to teleport around and rotate themselves. Immersive apps/games can design their own behavior for this control.

A control on the motion controller. Inside the mixed reality Home users can use the touchpad to scroll content inside Slates and to rotate objects while holding on to them. Immersive apps/games can design their own behavior for this control.
A control on the motion controller. Inside the mixed reality Home users use the trigger to do the select or select + hold actions. Immersive apps/games can design their own behavior for this control.
On mixed reality controllers, the button used to bring up the context menu in Shell.
A control on the handle of the motion controller. Inside the mixed reality Home this control is not currently used. Immersive apps/games can design their own behavior for this control.
The Holobar button that shows the 3D Holobar.
The keyboard voice shortcut that starts a dictation session.
A head-mounted display (HMD) that blends virtual content within the physical world. A subset of “mixed reality headset”, to be looked at in contrast with “immersive headset".​​
A head-mounted display (HMD) where all or most of the computing power happens on a connected PC. Without that associated PC, the headset cannot function​.
A head-mounted display (HMD) for which all computing power is contained in the headset. Example of self-contained headset is Microsoft HoloLens.
The keyboard voice shortcut that stops a dictation session.
The keyboard voice shortcut that deletes what has just been dictated during a dictation session.
The keyboard voice shortcut that selects all text in text field during a dictation session.

The app in the Windows Mixed Reality home environment​ that looks like an animated gift bag. It's intended to notify the user of new or trending mixed reality content. ​The gift bag will animate when it has new content to offer. When selected, it will reveal content that will eventually be personalized to the user. The content will include, but is not limited to, Store content.

The Windows feature for controlling the cursor, mouse clicks, text input, and communication with the movement of your eyes, using an on-screen keyboard and other software controls together with eye-tracking hardware​.

The app that allows users to change their Xbox avatars, start fresh with brand new ones, or take pictures of their avatars to share with friends. Users can also export avatars as 3D models for 3D printing or for use in Paint 3D.

The app that allows users to change their Xbox avatars, start fresh with brand new ones, or take pictures of their avatars to share with friends. Users can also export avatars as 3D models for 3D printing or for use in Paint 3D.
The main character for a set of stickers in Microsoft Teams depicting a pessimistic office worker.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that depicts a cat wearing a suit.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that depicts a team of graphic designers.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that shows different robots with developer-related messages.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that shows different sharks with legal-related messages.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that contains images to create personalized memes.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that depicts a playful monkey in different situations.
The main character for a set of stickers in Microsoft Teams depicting a playful monkey.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that depicts a red octopus with a unicorn horn in different situations.
The main character for a set of stickers in Microsoft Teams depicting a red octopus with a unicorn horn.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that depicts office workers in classical comic style.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that shows the most commonly used ones.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that shows different messages in the format of rubber stamps.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that depicts the Sasquatch-like creature Teamsquatch and his friends in different situations.
The main character for a set of stickers in Microsoft Teams depicting a Sasquatch-like creature who is working in an office.
The set of stickers in Microsoft Teams that contains several informal expressions in different font types.
The Azure service that provides defense against DDoS attacks.
The feature that allows you to link two Xbox controllers together in a game and use them as one, with both controllers maintaining full control.
The Microsoft Enterprise solution that includes Office 365, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Enterprise Mobility + Security.

The audience of workers who are the first point of contact between companies and others and who are dealing directly with customers and the supply chain or who are directly involved in making or servicing a product.

A cloud deployment solution that leverages the cloud to automate the configuration of new PCs including changing default start up screens without the need of IT assistance.

In Windows, an input panel where user can insert emojis and other expressive images or symbols. When using the en-US hardware keyboard to type, user can use SPACE+ : (colon) to input emoji in an easy and smart way. Rather than having to use the mouse, user can bring up the emoji panel and search or arrow key through the options. Eventually, this panel will include stickers and other expression objects.

The app for Windows 10 desktop PCs that enables easy sideloading of Windows 10 apps. The app allows developers to install .appx or .appx bundle files on their Windows 10 PC without the need to use PowerShell.

A worker who serves as the first point of contact between companies, their customers, products, suppliers and the market and who often directly impact the customer experience and the delivery and development of products and services.

The filter that users can apply to a photo or video clip to add an adventurous atmosphere and create a theme along with a related text style and music.

The consumer-facing name for Hypervisor Code Integrity (HVCI). The HVCI service in Windows 10 determines whether code executing in kernel mode is securely designed and trustworthy, and helps ensure that all software running in kernel mode, including drivers, securely allocate memory and operate as they are intended.

The voice command used to invoke Cortana to take over your mouse pointer and literally show you how to change a setting when you ask her to "show me (how to do something)." She performs each step for you in a sequence of clicks needed to make a particular change in Windows Settings.

The consumer-friendly name for virtualization-based security (VBS). The VBS service in Windows 10 uses hardware virtualization features to create and isolate a secure region of memory from the normal operating system.

The most important person in a video that you create using the video remix feature in Microsoft Photos. When ​the user selects a person as the "star," then photos and video clip​s of that person will be featured more prominently than other content in the video.​

In Windows Mixed Reality, one of the virtual environments (places) a user can choose to have as their virtual home. In it, users can use and pin apps, holograms, and other content. A type of plan used to control the delivery of base pay and awards. An employee's fixed base pay and merit increases are controlled through fixed compensation plans. The payment of incentive pay, such as bonus payments, performance awards, stock options, and grants, and also one-time awards, are controlled through variable compensation plans.
Integral types where labels are assigned to a subset of the values; these can be used in place of literals to make code more readable and maintainable.
A configuration to generate electronic reports, for both incoming and outgoing electronic documents in accordance with the legal requirements of various countries/regions.
An amount that does not change in itself but to which other amounts can be added or deducted from.
Additional benefit or compensation complementing a worker's base salary, normally in kind.
An amount deducted from a worker's salary, for example, for tax purposes.

an increase based on the employee’s pay rate as of the cycle end date and the increase percent found in the fixed increase budget for the employee’s department, labor union, and location that has to do with an employee's efficiency or meeting agreed performance targets.
The structured process by which employees leave an organization.
Interval that workers are paid in. A pay cycle determines how often payroll is run and the specific days that workers are paid on.
Duration and frequency established for a pay cycle to run. For example, monthly, bi-monthly etc.
Document showing all calculations for worker deductions and employer contributions for benefits and taxes, how benefit accruals have been processed, and the worker’s net pay determined.

Personnel actions are additional steps that you must complete when you perform certain personnel-related tasks. Examples of tasks that might require personnel actions are when you create new positions, modify existing position values, hire new workers, transfer workers, change worker compensation, change position assignments, or terminate workers.

The accounting rules that are applied when earnings are posted that are generated for this earning code. The main account for distributions is based on the department, job, and worker selections for each posting rule.
Codes related to an extra earning paid to an employee when specific conditions are met, e.g. overtime, etc.
The record buffer is a memory area for storing Web object variables and database field values that are directly output to or input from a database.

A signing limit defines the largest financial commitment that a worker is authorized to make on behalf of an employer. As a direct result of a worker's spending activity, and approval of the spending activity by the worker's manager, the organization may form a contractual relationship with a third party.

Engine that calculates tax amounts for a certain transaction, it is an essential part of the configurable business application experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations. It's highly customizable and lets a business user, functional consultant, or power user configure tax rules that determine tax applicability, calculation, posting, and settlement, based on legal and business requirements.
A tax data classifier based on the Tax Identification Number (TIN) and used for tax calculation and reporting in Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations.
Mandatory deductions on a salary to meet local or other tax requirements.
Tax regions are geographic areas where a specific set of payroll taxes applies. Generally, tax regions correspond to the cities or towns where your workers reside or work.

A technology often found in identity management software that allows users who have either forgotten their password or activated an intruder lockout to authenticate with an alternate factor and to resolve the issue on their own.

Pertaining to authentication means that do not require a password.
A capability that allows admins to create policies for resources such as groups, apps, and sites, and automate the process of granting access to employees and partners.
The portal where employees and partners request access to entitlements and business managers approve access requests.
A customer's right to use a resource.
An assessment of business-related issues regarding specific actions or recommended changes.
A package that contains access permissions that can be requested for given resources.
An external user who gets invited into an organization for access to specific resources, but signs in using an ID from a different organization.
A root of a polynomial that is a rational number.
An algebraic expression of the sum or the difference of two or more terms.
A number that can be expressed as a quotient of two integers.
Of, pertaining to, or being an object or image having or appearing to have two spatial dimensions (length and width).

Collective term for the complete set of objects that you can add to a step to support that step. Assets include 2D objects (images and videos) and 3D objects (3D parts and objects from the 3D toolkit).
3D content that you assign to a step to support that step. You assign 3D parts in the PC application, and then place the holograms in a real-world environment in HoloLens Authoring mode.
A 3D CAD model or scanned model of an object in the real world.

A library of predefined objects included in Guides that user can use to get started right away. For example, there are 3D objects such as pointers and arrows that you can add to a step to support that step.
To air tap and keep the index finger in the down position.
In Dynamics 365 Guides, to "line up" a guide with associated objects in the real world when used on a HoloLens.
In Dynamics 365 Guides, the process of lining up a guide with associated objects in the real world when used on a HoloLens; alignment is crucial and mandatory for creating any guide.
The mode in Dynamics 365 Remote Assist that allows the user to point things out in their space.
The tool in Dynamics 365 Remote Assist that allows the user to place an arrow in their space.
The person who creates a guide in Dynamics 365 Guides.
A process in which HoloLens adjusts the hologram display according to a user's interpupillary distance (IPD).
A device designed specifically for HoloLens that gives you another way to interact with holograms. You can use it in place of hand gestures to select, scroll, move, and resize.

A 3D representation used to anchor holograms in the real world. You place the digital representation, which can be a CAD model or scanned model, directly over its counterpart in the real world, and then use a gesture to align the guide to the digital anchor.
The measurement/scale camera view of an asset model.
In Guides Analytics, to expand the data view to the next level.
The setting in Dynamics 365 Guides that adjusts the volume dynamically based on noise in the environment. For example, if the environment is very noisy, the volume adjusts upward automatically.
The portal where users can review the status of their apps and solutions, apply updates, and manage their Dynamics 365 instances, solutions, and apps.

A rectangular viewport powered by a mixed reality headset. It allows users to see digital content overlaid onto the real world around them.
A hand gesture that enables operators to do actions in mixed reality.
A file created in Dynamics 365 Guides that includes step-by-step instructions with images, video, and 3D holograms.

The part of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides in preview application suite that includes the Guides PC authoring app and the Guides HoloLens app. It can be used to analyze the usage of guides across organization. Guides Analytics consists of Power BI visual reports which are populated with Guides usage data stored securely in the Dynamics 365 environment.
Of, pertaining to, or being a hologram.
In HoloLens, a virtual button used to rotate an asset in order to place it at the correct orientation.
A computer-generated visual used for one type of alignment. You gaze at the marker to align the guide with its spatial coordinates.

One of the alignment methods in Dynamics 365 Guides where a user attaches a printed marker to a physical object in the real world. After creating the guide, to align the guide in the real world, the user gazes at the marker using the HoloLens.
The Microsoft Azure web service that transcodes and simplifies a 3D model and then returns the simplified model to the Import Tool, restricting access via the use of obfuscated URLs.
The document describing Microsoft's position on privacy, detailing what information it collects, with whom the data is shared, and how users can control the use of their personal information.

The setting in Dynamics 365 Guides that enables you to use voice commands to navigate the app when there’s a lot of noise in your environment (a factory floor, for example). The app supports noise levels up to 80 decibels.
The person who uses a guide to do a set of tasks in Dynamics 365 Guides.

The page in the PC Authoring application that you use to add tasks and steps. From the Outline page, you can get a sense of the whole guide and restructure tasks by dragging them from one place to another. The Outline page also includes customizable alignment instructions and a special step called the Completion step (also customizable).
The orbital perspective camera view of an asset model.
The total number of polygons in a 3D model.
The portal where PowerApps administrators can manage environments and settings for PowerApps.
A licensing plan for PowerApps that allows users to run model-driven apps with code plug-ins and real-time workflows.
The Guides Analytics report that shows the usage and step-level run time data for a single guide.

A window in the mixed reality experience.
To watch on a 2D screen what a HoloLens user sees in their mixed reality experience.
A short, discrete work item that an operator does to complete a task. Tasks are made up of steps. Steps are also the central navigation point in a guide.
A piece of work to be done or undertaken. A task is made up of steps that the operator must follow to complete the task.

A holographic link that ties a step visually to the area where you want the operator to focus. It helps the operator find content or understand what they’re supposed to be looking at in the real world. You can use a tether together with a 3D object, such as a holographic arrow or number.
In computer graphics, a process of adding graphics to a polygon object. These graphics can be anything from PNGs, JPGs, TGAs to any other formats.
To convert multimedia content from one form to another.
A tool that converts multimedia content from one form to another.

The amount or percentage of time an object remains nonfunctional due to maintenance.
Anticipated maintenance requirements and material available to meet these needs, including both emergencies and other scheduled maintenance activities.

Expected, preventive maintenance activities.

To convert a radical in the denominator of an algebraic fraction to a rational number.
An algebraic expression that contains one term, such as: 3xy.
An algebraic expression of the sum or the difference of two terms.

The property of multiplication whereby when a number is multiplied by the sum of two numbers, the first number can be distributed to both of those numbers and multiplied by each of them separately, and the two products can then be added together for the same result as multiplying the first number by the sum. For example: 2 x (3 + 5) = 2 x 3 + 2 x 5

An integer that is the square of an integer; it is the product of some integer with itself. For example, 9 is a perfect square, since it can be written as 3 × 3. Any number multiplied by itself creates a perfect square.
The result of multiplying, or an expression that identifies factors to be multiplied. For example, 15 is the product of 3 and 5, and x(2+x) is the product of x and 2+x.
A theorem linking factors and zeros of a polynomial.

Theorem that for a polynomial equation in one variable with integer coefficients to have a solution (root) that is a rational number, the leading coefficient (the coefficient of the highest power) must be divisible by the denominator of the fraction and the constant term (the one without a variable) must be divisible by the numerator.

When referring to a manager, or to a meeting involving a manager, "skip-level" refers to the employee's manager's manager, sometimes referred to as "second line manager". A skip-level manager is the manager of the employee's manager. A skip-level meeting is a meeting between an employee and the manager of his or her manager.

An inspection of devices, mailboxes, and other types of entities performed automatically in response to various detections, after which remediation actions might be taken on malicious and suspicious items found during the investigation.

A threat remediation mechanism that automatically applies various actions, such as file quarantine or deletion of persistence mechanism in the registry, based on the results of a corresponding automated investigation.

The Pride-themed decal or sticker, usually made of vinyl, adhered to the device surface (cell phone, Surface products, Xbox consoles and controllers, etc.) to give it a unique and personal look with graphics that celebrate the LGBTQI+ Pride month of June.

Descriptive of any content or feature available to a customer who upgrades from a free service to a paid service, as part of that larger offering.

To stream the content of a user's device screen or a separate window to the screens of other users' devices, so these users could remotely see the screen of the user who shares it.
