An accounting technique used to periodically lower the book value of a loan or intangible asset over a set period of time.
A series of payments made at equal intervals.
A big one-time payment at the end of the lease with lower monthly payments throughout the lease term.
A lease agreement that allows the lessee to purchase the leased asset at the end of the lease period at a lower price.
A liability resulting from the difference between actual cash paid and the straight-line expense recorded on the lessee's financial statements.

Any expenditure not included in the minimum ongoing payments associated with a lease. The lessee reimburses the lessor for any executory costs incurred by the lessor. Examples of executory costs are property taxes, insurance, and maintenance expenses.
A rational and unbiased estimate of the potential market price of an asset.

A type of lease in which a finance company is typically the legal owner of the asset for the duration of the lease, while the lessee not only has operating control over the asset, but also some share of the economic risks and returns from the change in the valuation of the underlying asset.
A fee charged when a lessee uses the real property after their lease expiration date.

A permanent reduction in the carrying value of an asset below its fair value or recoverable amount, which occurs when it is deemed improbable that the lease receivable will be recovered in accordance with the contractual terms of the lease.
An interest rate the lessee would have to pay to borrow the value of the asset over a similar term length and with similar security.
An interest rate that is tied to a specific benchmark with rate changes based on the movement of the benchmark.
A cost that is directly associated with negotiating and completing an agreement.
A non-operating expense shown on the income statement. It represents interest payable on any borrowings – bonds, loans, convertible debt or lines of credit.
A legal agreement in which the right to use real or personal property or services is conveyed over a limited amount of time and for some form of payment.
A payment made by the lessor to the company as an incentive to sign the lease.
In accounting, a financial obligation to make the payments arising from a lease, measured on a discounted basis.
An amount provided by the lessee on a regular basis to the owner of the property or services for a specific period of time in exchange for use.
Fixed, non-cancelable period for which a lease agreement is in force.
An asset that is leased by the owner to another party in return of money or some other form of payment.
A person to whom the right to use real or personal property or services is conveyed under a lease agreement.
A person who conveys the right to use real or personal property or services under a lease agreement.
A lease for which the underlying asset is of low value.
A type of lease that allows for the use of an asset but does not convey ownership rights of the asset.
In accounting, a remaining value of an asset after it has been fully depreciated.
In accounting, the lessee's license to hold, operate, or occupy the leased property or item over the lease term.
In accounting, the lessee's license to hold, operate, or occupy the leased property or item over the lease term.

A sum of money paid by the lessee and held by the lessor during the lease's term. A security deposit is held to offset the damages the lessor may suffer as a result of the breach of the lessee's lease obligations either during or at the end of the lease term.
A lease with a duration of less than or equal to the short term threshold in the lease book setup.
An asset that is subject to a lease, for which the right to use that asset has been provided by a lessor to a lessee.
An accounting estimate of the number of years an asset is likely to remain in service for the purpose of cost-effective revenue generation.

The product that uses artificial intelligence to process content across existing Microsoft technologies in order to organize content and expertise into a knowledge network based around relationships among topics, content, and people.
The line an error gets underscored with in apps like Word or Outlook during spell check.
To orchestrate a collaboration session.
The feature of sharing access to the user's current location, letting others see what their geographical position is.

The act of using a smartphone app to block and filter websites and apps, monitor chats and texts, manage screen time, and perform other functions related to controlling and reporting on that phone's activities, usually with the aim towards making the phone safer to use by children.
A virtual visual effect displayed behind a video call/meeting participant's camera-captured image.
A virtual visual effect displayed behind a video call/meeting participant's camera-captured image.
A meeting with a video stream of its participants.
A feature that limits battery charging capacity to 50%, which slows the aging process and prolongs battery longevity.

A feature that helps protect a battery from the cumulative negative effects of consistent and recurrent use at high temperatures or high states of charge by monitoring battery conditions continuously and implementing a limited number of permanent reductions in charging voltage if these adverse conditions are detected.
The Slovenian national holiday celebrated on June 25 to commemorate Slovenia's declaration of independence from Yugoslavia in 1991.

The national holiday in Bosnia and Herzegovina celebrated on November 25 to commemorate the day in 1943 on which ZAVNOBiH, the Anti-Fascist Council of Bosnia and Herzegovina, adopted a resolution to declare the country/region an equal community of Muslims, Serbs, and Croats.
The Czech national holiday celebrated on September 28 to commemorate the day in 935 on which St. Wenceslas, patron of the Czech state, was murdered by his brother.
The Argentinian national holiday celebrated on June 20 to commemorate the Argentine flag and its creator, Manuel Belgrano.
The supplementary holiday day that may be granted during years in which Argentina's Flag Day occurs on a Tuesday or a Thursday and is used to create a four-day weekend.
The Mexican national holiday celebrated on February 24 to commemorate past and current flags of Mexico.
The national holiday in Poland celebrated on May 2 to commemorate the raising of the Polish flag over the Victory Column at the end of the Battle of Berlin in 1945.
The Azerbaijan national holiday celebrated on November 9 to commemorate the adoption of the Flag of Azerbaijan on November 9, 1918.
The day on which the Azerbaijan National Flag Day is celebrated if the official holiday itself falls on a weekend.
To prevent a UI element such as an error, notification, button, or a visual feature such as line numbers or page margins, from appearing to the end user.
Implies that the artifact (object or activity) or some of its characteristics deviate from what is considered ‘normal’; typically a statistical outlier.

A feature of the Windows Clock app that allows the user to set a timer for a period of focus time.

The international holiday celebrated on March 8 that honors women and is commemorated in various ways around the world, including as a public holiday, a day of protest, or as a celebration of womanhood.
